trans-unit.source: Technologies for accessing the network and web services.
trans-unit.target: Technologies for accessing the network and web services.

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: The following networking and web services technologies are available for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) developers.
trans-unit.target: The following networking and web services technologies are available for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) developers.

trans-unit.source: Things you must do for any network-enabled app.
trans-unit.target: Things you must do for any network-enabled app.

trans-unit.source: A quick overview of the networking technologies available for a UWP developer, with suggestions on how to choose the technologies that are right for your app.
trans-unit.target: A quick overview of the networking technologies available for a UWP developer, with suggestions on how to choose the technologies that are right for your app.

trans-unit.source: Apps use background tasks and two main mechanisms to maintain communications when they are not in the foreground: The socket broker, and control channel triggers.
trans-unit.target: Apps use background tasks and two main mechanisms to maintain communications when they are not in the foreground: The socket broker, and control channel triggers.

trans-unit.source: You can use both [Winsock](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms737523) to communicate with other devices as a UWP app developer.
trans-unit.target: You can use both [Winsock](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms737523) to communicate with other devices as a UWP app developer.

trans-unit.source: This topic provides in-depth guidance on using the Windows.Networking.Sockets namespace to perform networking operations.
trans-unit.target: This topic provides in-depth guidance on using the Windows.Networking.Sockets namespace to perform networking operations.

trans-unit.source: WebSockets provide a mechanism for fast, secure two-way communication between a client and a server over the web using HTTP(S).
trans-unit.target: WebSockets provide a mechanism for fast, secure two-way communication between a client and a server over the web using HTTP(S).

trans-unit.source: Use [Windows.Web.Http](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279692) namespace API to send and receive information using the HTTP 2.0 and HTTP 1.1 protocols.
trans-unit.target: Use [Windows.Web.Http](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279692) namespace API to send and receive information using the HTTP 2.0 and HTTP 1.1 protocols.

trans-unit.source: Retrieve or create the most current and popular Web content using syndicated feeds generated according to the RSS and Atom standards using features in the [Windows.Web.Syndication](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br243632) namespace.
trans-unit.target: Retrieve or create the most current and popular Web content using syndicated feeds generated according to the RSS and Atom standards using features in the [Windows.Web.Syndication](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br243632) namespace.

trans-unit.source: Use the background transfer API to copy files reliably over the network.
trans-unit.target: Use the background transfer API to copy files reliably over the network.
